text: Also, right now at school my final outcome is going to be an animation so I will show them what I'm working on right now
Hi Laura. You show some good techniques and a good range of skillets using different art mediums.

What is really good to also include is artwork that you did in some of your internships, even if they were collaborative projects. 
So showing woke this is original pieces, and ideas. 
The drawings of the Disney characters are very good but mostly demonstrate techniques, rather than your own ideas. Still include them in your portfolio. 

I would guess BRiTS wants to see and hear about your own ideas too of what your have done, and want to pursue in further studies with them.
Definitely show your animation since you are applying for that department and/or interactive design.

If it’s a work in progress, then have a good clear think about how you want to improve and take that animation further. 
Again, they want o hear your ideas too. That’s what usually appeals to an admissions person for a Art school. That’s what my school looks for. Techniques cal always be taught, but ideas come from you :wink:
So wrote down your ideas on your animation and be ready to explain them so they can also evaluate your artist thoughts. 

An interview is a chance to sell yourself!! 

So be proud of what you have accomplished already which is great! and then entice them what you desire to learn more about by using your artwork as examples to explain how you want to advance your ideas, and techniques. .

If you have an industry example of what you would like to achieve with your animation, then that is good to also show. That shows your level so understanding of the animation or interactive industy , which they like to see

Feel free to send me any answers you are thinking of and I can give you feedback since all that I explained might sound vague :wink:
When is your interview?
